column1: 4dwm_based¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes.git¤master¤themes/4dwm_based¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes¤Paulo Silva¤4dwm_based¤This is just a PekWM theme superficially based on SGI Irix 4DWM window manager - the button
column2: decoration bevel and window title text arrangement is different from the original
column3: and the button icons changes on mouse over and pressed behaviours (the original 4DWM ones doesn't do this).

column2: ported from the E17 Detour theme by Alberto Castro aka Tokyo.
port of the E16 theme by kvas¤LightOne
column3: ported from the E16 LightOne theme by kvas.

column1: NeoMotif¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes.git¤master¤themes/NeoMotif¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes¤Paulo Silva¤NeoMotif¤An embrionary stage of a Motif-like theme for PekWM

column2: previously named purple-p¤Original theme from the early days of pekwm

column3: ported from the Fluxbox m0nst4 theme by Christoph Strake aka chr1z.

column2: port of a theme for mavosxwm¤mavon-t
column3: originally ported from mavosxwm to pekwm by chr1z.

column1: semitif¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes.git¤master¤themes/semitif¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes¤Paulo Silva¤Semitif¤A request of Claes Nästén (PekWM author)
column2: which theme i were also very curious to know how fine it would look on PekWM - mostly because it's a bit hard to find Motif-like themes available
column3: which brings so nostalgic memories from all long-time Unix users.

column2: port of E16 spiff theme by Garrett LeSage¤Early pekwm theme that has been updated multiple times over the years by amongst others okraits.

column1: windowmakerbased_4lba¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes.git¤master¤themes/windowmakerbased_4lba¤https://notabug.org/nitrofurano/pekwmthemes¤Paulo Silva¤WindowMaker-based¤This one was a bit based on WindowMaker window decoration - the buttons are a bit different
column2: all arranged in the left side
column3: and they all have hover and press behaviours.
